August 23, 1965

Mr. R. A. Stuart
Traynor, Sask.

Dear Mr. Stuart:

I wish to acknowledge with thanks the receipt of the pioneer questionnaire which you completed for us. I am very sorry to hear that you have had an unfortunate land dealing which has marred your retirement.

I note that you have some pictures you would be willing to give us or loan us. I would be glad if you would send these pictures to me and let me know whether they are on loan or whether you wish to make a gift of them. Thank you.

Yours sincerely,

D. H. Backing
Assistant Provincial Archivist

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

NOTE: Please print all proper names and place names in capital letters. If you are not sure the name is correct as you have given it, please say so. It is quite acceptable to have someone else do the writing at your dictation.

1. Your full name ROBERT ANDREW STUART
2. Your address TRAVNOR
3. Date Aug 16th
4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country).
   Artemesia TWP Grey Co Ont.
5. What was your father's name and occupation?
   Farmer Mail driver
6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year).
   May 23rd 1906
7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible.
   Winnipeg 1893 to 1906
8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may use "I was a small child," "I was in my teens," etc.)

9. What were your reasons for coming West?
   My father employed by C.P.R Freight Dept was a strike 1905 Dept. And he came out to Battleford took up homestead for us 2 and others. Barry Stuarts Henderson Beach Mr. Gavin Orr. was foreman 3rd Ave Church and W.B carpenter teacher
10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Railroad or government information?)
    Another man named Wilson was killed subway W.P.G. hauling water pipe team of horses became frightened Was most taken and be us. Brother wanted to sell team 1600 lbs to father kept in our stable Would have been 1st class big team instead bought small horses and had to buy when to haul effects.
